verses.roman:
pālaka hañā pālyere tāḍite nā yuyāya
tumi sarva-śāstra jāna jindā-pīra'-prāya"

synonyms: pālaka hañā—being a maintainer; pālyere—the person who is maintained; tāḍite—to punish; nā yuyāya—is not good; tumi—you; sarva-śāstra—all scriptures; jāna—know; jindā-pīra—a living saintly person; prāya—just like.
translation: "For a maintainer to punish the person he maintains is not good. You are expert in all the scriptures. Indeed, you are like a living saint."
